org.hypergraphdb.viewer.phoebe

Class PNodeView

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umd.cs.piccolo.PNode
      • edu.umd.cs.piccolo.nodes.PPath
        • org.hypergraphdb.viewer.phoebe.PNodeView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class PNodeView
extends edu.umd.cs.piccolo.nodes.PPath
    This class extends a PNode and does most of what PPath would do but lets the painting get done by NodePainter
    Author:
    Rowan Christmas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setXPosition

        public void setXPosition(double new_x_position)
        This immediatly moves the node to a new X coordinate.
        Parameters:
        the - new_x_position for this node

      • setXPosition

        public void setXPosition(double new_x_position,
                         boolean no_sandbox)
        Passing "false" to this method will use the built-in sandbox for storing node positions. If using the sandbox, getXPosition will return the sandbox value. After calling setNodePosition the sandboxed values will be applied to the PNodeView.

        Sandbox usage:
        1) setNodeX/YPosition( value, false );
        2) getNodeX/YPosition();
        repeat... 3) setNodePosition( boolean animate ); // true will animate the node to the sandboxed position.
        Parameters:
        new_x_position - for this node
        no_sandbox - if this is true, the node will move immediatly.

      • getXPosition

        public double getXPosition()
        Returns:
        the current x position of this node, or sandboxed position
        See Also:
        setXPosition

      • setYPosition

        public void setYPosition(double new_y_position)

        public void setShape(int shape)
        Set a new shape for the FNode, based on one of the pre-defined shapes Note: calling setPathTo( Shape ), allows one to define their own java.awt.Shape ( i.e. A picture of Johnny Cash )
